item.title: L-systems
item.description: An L-system (Lindenmeyer system) is a parallel rewriting system. We decide on an alphabet $V$, set of rewriting rules $P$, and a starting axiom $\omega$. Starting from the axiom we apply all rules simultaneously, rewriting the string, and producing the next iteration. This then repeats. For instance, if $V = { A, B }$, $\omega = { B }$, and $P = { A \to AA, B \to BA }$, then the first couple of iterations will look like:
